t: Proverbs 5
Warning Against Adultery
My*pn son, be attentive to my wisdom; incline*ld your ear to my understanding,
that*ln you may keep discretion, and*ld your lips may guard knowledge.
For*ln the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey, and*ld her speech is smoother than oil,
but*ln in the end she is bitter as wormwood, sharp*ld as a two-edged sword.
Her*ln feet go down to death; her*ld steps follow the path to Sheol;
she*ln does not ponder the path of life; her*ld ways wander, and she does not know it.
And*pn now, O sons, listen to me, and*ld do not depart from the words of my mouth.
Keep*ln your way far from her, and*ld do not go near the door of her house,
lest*ln you give your honor to others and*ld your years to the merciless,
lest*ln strangers take their fill of your strength, and*ld your labors go to the house of a foreigner,
and*ln at the end of your life you groan, when*ld your flesh and body are consumed,
and*ln you say, “How I hated discipline, and*ld my heart despised reproof!
I*ln did not listen to the voice of my teachers or*ld incline my ear to my instructors.
I*ln am at the brink of utter ruin in*ld the assembled congregation.”
Drink*pn water from your own cistern, flowing*ld water from your own well.
Should*ln your springs be scattered abroad, streams*ld of water in the streets?
Let*ln them be for yourself alone, and*ld not for strangers with you.
Let*ln your fountain be blessed, and*ld rejoice in the wife of your youth,
a*ld lovely deer, a graceful doe. Let*ln her breasts fill you at all times with delight; be*ld intoxicated always in her love.
Why*ln should you be intoxicated, my son, with a forbidden woman and*ld embrace the bosom of an adulteress?
For*ln a man’s ways are before the eyes of the Lord,*s and*ld he ponders all his paths.
The*ln iniquities of the wicked ensnare him, and*ld he is held fast in the cords of his sin.
He*ln dies for lack of discipline, and*ld because of his great folly he is led astray.
